trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Adaptive Suite | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Adaptive Suite | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Adaptive Suite with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Adaptive Suite with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Adaptive Suite.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Adaptive Suite.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An Adaptive Suite tenant
trans-unit.target: An Adaptive Suite tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Adaptive Suite will be able to single sign into the application at your Adaptive Suite company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Adaptive Suite will be able to single sign into the application at your Adaptive Suite company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Adaptive Suite
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Adaptive Suite

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Adaptive Suite.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Adaptive Suite.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Adaptive Suite.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Adaptive Suite.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Adaptive Suite, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Adaptive Suite, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adaptive Suite</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adaptive Suite</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Adaptive Suite with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Adaptive Suite with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Adaptive Suite requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Adaptive Suite requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Adaptive Suite application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Adaptive Suite application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Adaptive Suite page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Adaptive Suite page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings page, in the Reply URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://login.adaptiveinsights.com:443/samlsso/RlJFRVRSSUFMMTI3MTE=", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings page, in the Reply URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://login.adaptiveinsights.com:443/samlsso/RlJFRVRSSUFMMTI3MTE=", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: You can get this value from the Adaptive Suite’s SAML SSO Settings page.
trans-unit.target: You can get this value from the Adaptive Suite’s SAML SSO Settings page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Adaptive Suite company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Adaptive Suite company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Users and Roles section, click Manage SAML SSO Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the Users and Roles section, click Manage SAML SSO Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage SAML SSO Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage SAML SSO Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the SAML SSO Settings page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML SSO Settings page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML SSO Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML SSO Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Identity provider name textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Identity provider name textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Identity provider Entity ID textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the Identity provider Entity ID textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Identity provider SSO URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Identity provider SSO URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Custom logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adaptive Suite dialog page, copy the SAML SSO URL value, and then paste it into the Custom logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded certificate, click Choose file.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded certificate, click Choose file.

trans-unit.source: As SAML user id, select User’s Adaptive Insights user name.
trans-unit.target: As SAML user id, select User’s Adaptive Insights user name.

trans-unit.source: As SAML user id location, select User id in NameID of Subject.
trans-unit.target: As SAML user id location, select User id in NameID of Subject.

trans-unit.source: As SAML NameID format, select Email address.
trans-unit.target: As SAML NameID format, select Email address.

trans-unit.source: As Enable SAML, select Allow SAML SSO and direct Adaptive Insights login.
trans-unit.target: As Enable SAML, select Allow SAML SSO and direct Adaptive Insights login.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Adaptive Suite, they must be provisioned into Adaptive Suite.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Adaptive Suite, they must be provisioned into Adaptive Suite.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Adaptive Suite, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Adaptive Suite, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Adaptive Suite company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Adaptive Suite company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Users and Roles section, click Add User.
trans-unit.target: In the Users and Roles section, click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the New User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Submit</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submit</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Name, Login, Email, Password of a valid Azure Active Directory user you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Name, Login, Email, Password of a valid Azure Active Directory user you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Select a Role.
trans-unit.target: Select a Role.

trans-unit.source: Click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Adaptive Suite user account creation tools or APIs provided by Adaptive Suite to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Adaptive Suite user account creation tools or APIs provided by Adaptive Suite to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Adaptive Suite **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Adaptive Suite **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
